advertiseHost.desc: The advertise address of the local node exposed to admins. (e.g. 100.131.251.96)

advertiseStrategy.desc: The advertise strategy is used to decide which type of address should be used so that admins can access admin APIs and metrics APIs

attachPortToHost.desc:
Whether to attach the local port to the host.
e.g. The local host is 100.131.251.96, and the port is 9510 so the service address will be 100.131.251.96:9510

delayToNotifyMembersChangeSeconds.desc: Delay notifying listeners on members change. Waits for seconds to avoid thundering herd

id.desc: The node ID must start with a letter or underscore, and matches zero or more of characters [a-zA-Z0-9_] after the beginning. e.g. "turms001", "turms_002"

leaderEligible.desc: Only works when it's a turms-service node

requestTimeoutMillis.desc: The timeout for RPC requests in milliseconds

closedRecordingRetentionPeriod.desc: A closed recording will be retained for the given period and will be removed from the file system after the retention period. 0 means no retention. -1 means unlimited retention.

advertiseHost.desc: The advertise address of the local node exposed to admins. (e.g. 100.131.251.96)

advertiseStrategy.desc: The advertise strategy is used to decide which type of address should be used so that admins can access admin APIs and metrics APIs

attachPortToHost.desc:
Whether to attach the local port to the host.
e.g. The local host is 100.131.251.96, and the port is 9510 so the service address will be 100.131.251.96:9510

enabled.desc: Whether to enable the APIs for administrators

logRequestParams.desc: Whether to log the parameters of requests

capacity.desc: The maximum number of tokens that the bucket can hold

initialTokens.desc: The initial number of tokens for new session

refillIntervalMillis.desc: The time interval to refill. 0 means never refill

tokensPerPeriod.desc: Refills the bucket with the specified number of tokens per period if the bucket isn't full

useAuthentication.desc: Whether to use authentication. If false, all HTTP requesters will personate the root user and all HTTP requests will be passed. You may set it to false when you want to manage authentication via security groups, NACL, etc

excludedNotificationCategories.desc: Turms will get the notifications to log from the union of "includedNotificationCategories" and "includedNotifications" except the notifications included in "excludedNotificationCategories" and "excludedNotificationTypes"

excludedNotificationTypes.desc: Turms will get the notifications to log from the union of "includedNotificationCategories" and "includedNotifications" except the notifications included in "excludedNotificationCategories" and "excludedNotificationTypes"

excludedRequestCategories.desc: Turms will get the requests to log from the union of "includedRequestCategories" and "includedRequests" except the requests included in "excludedRequestCategories" and "excludedRequestTypes"

excludedRequestTypes.desc: Turms will get the requests to log from the union of "includedRequestCategories" and "includedRequests" except the requests included in "excludedRequestCategories" and "excludedRequestTypes"

includedNotificationCategories.desc: Turms will get the notifications to log from the union of "includedNotificationCategories" and "includedNotifications" except the notifications included in "excludedNotificationCategories" and "excludedNotificationTypes"

includedNotifications.desc: Turms will get the notifications to log from the union of "includedNotificationCategories" and "includedNotifications" except the notifications included in "excludedNotificationCategories" and "excludedNotificationTypes"

includedRequestCategories.desc: Turms will get the requests to log from the union of "includedRequestCategories" and "includedRequests" except the requests included in "excludedRequestCategories" and "excludedRequestTypes"

includedRequests.desc: Turms will get the requests to log from the union of "includedRequestCategories" and "includedRequests" except the requests included in "excludedRequestCategories" and "excludedRequestTypes"

maxRequestSizeBytes.desc: The client session will be closed and may be blocked if it tries to send a request larger than the size. Note: The average size of turms requests is 16~64 bytes

capacity.desc: The maximum number of tokens that the bucket can hold

initialTokens.desc: The initial number of tokens for new session

refillIntervalMillis.desc: The time interval to refill. 0 means never refill

tokensPerPeriod.desc: Refills the bucket with the specified number of tokens per period if the bucket isn't full

returnReasonForServerError.desc: Whether to return the reason for the server error to the client. Note: 1. It may reveal sensitive data like the IP of internal servers if true; 2. turms-gateway never return the information of stack traces no matter it is true or false.

enabled.desc: Whether to fake clients. Note that faking only works in non-production environments

requestCountPerInterval.desc: The number of requests to send per interval. If requestIntervalMillis is 1000, requestCountPerInterval is TPS in fact

userCount.desc: Run the number of real clients as faked users with an ID from [firstUserId, firstUserId + userCount) to connect to turms-gateway. So please ensure you have set turms.service.fake.userCount to a number larger than or equals to (firstUserId + userCount)

enabled.desc: Whether to parse the buffer of TurmsNotification to log. Note that the property has an impact on performance

advertiseHost.desc:
The advertise address of the local node exposed to the public. The property can be used to advertise the DDoS Protected IP address to hide the origin IP address)
(e.g. 100.131.251.96)

advertiseStrategy.desc: The advertise strategy is used to help clients or load balancing servers to access the local node. Note: For security, do NOT use PUBLIC_ADDRESS in production to prevent from exposing the origin IP address for DDoS attack.

attachPortToHost.desc:
Whether to attach the local port to the host.
e.g. The local host is 100.131.251.96, and the port is 10510so the service address will be 100.131.251.96:10510

identity.desc: The identity of the local node will be sent to clients as a notification if identity is not blank and turms.gateway.session.notifyClientsOfSessionInfoAfterConnected is true (e.g. "turms-east-0001")

clientHeartbeatIntervalSeconds.desc: The client heartbeat interval. Note that the value will NOT change the actual heartbeat behavior of clients, and the value is only used to facilitate related operations of turms-gateway

closeIdleSessionAfterSeconds.desc: A session will be closed if turms server doesn't receive any request (including heartbeat request) from the client during closeIdleSessionAfterSeconds. References: https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MzAwNDY1ODY2OQ==&mid=207243549&idx=1&sn=4ebe4beb8123f1b5ab58810ac8bc5994&scene=0#rd

enabled.desc: Whether to authenticate and authorize users when logging in. Note that user ID is always required even if enabled is false. If false at startup, turms-gateway won't connect to the MongoDB server for user records

minHeartbeatIntervalSeconds.desc: The minimum interval to refresh the heartbeat status by client requests to avoid refreshing the heartbeat status frequently

notifyClientsOfSessionInfoAfterConnected.desc: Whether to notify clients of the session information after connected with the server

switchProtocolAfterSeconds.desc: If the turms server only receives heartbeat requests from the client during switchProtocolAfterSeconds, the TCP/WebSocket connection will be closed with the close status "SWITCH" to indicate the client should keep sending heartbeat requests over UDP if they want to keep online. Note: 1. The property only works if UDP is enabled; 2. For browser clients, UDP isn't supported

allowDeviceTypeOthersLogin.desc: Whether to allow the devices of DeviceType.OTHERS to login

allowDeviceTypeUnknownLogin.desc: Whether to allow the devices of DeviceType.UNKNOWN to login

loginConflictStrategy.desc: The login conflict strategy is used for servers to know how to behave if a device is logging in when there are conflicted and logged-in devices

strategy.desc: The simultaneous login strategy is used to control which devices can be online at the same time

backlog.desc: The maximum number of connection requests waiting in the backlog queue. Large enough to handle bursts and GC pauses but don't set too large to prevent SYN-Flood attacks

closeIdleConnectionAfterSeconds.desc: A TCP connection will be closed on the server side if a client hasn't established a user session in a specified time. Note that the developers on the client side should take the responsibility to close the TCP connection according to their business requirements

backlog.desc: The maximum number of connection requests waiting in the backlog queue. Large enough to handle bursts and GC pauses but don't set too large to prevent SYN-Flood attacks

closeIdleConnectionAfterSeconds.desc: A WebSocket connection will be closed on the server side if a client hasn't established a user session in a specified time. Note that the developers on the client side should take the responsibility to close the WebSocket connection according to their business requirements

connectTimeout.desc: Used to mitigate the Slowloris DoS attack by lowering the timeout for the TCP connection handshake

directMemoryWarningThresholdPercentage.desc: Log warning messages if the used direct memory exceeds the max direct memory of the percentage

heapMemoryGcThresholdPercentage.desc: If the used memory has used the reserved memory specified by maxAvailableMemoryPercentage and minFreeSystemMemoryBytes, try to start GC when the used heap memory exceeds the max heap memory of the percentage

heapMemoryWarningThresholdPercentage.desc: Log warning messages if the used heap memory exceeds the max heap memory of the percentage

maxAvailableDirectMemoryPercentage.desc: The server will refuse to serve when the used direct memory exceeds the max direct memory of the percentage to try to avoid OutOfMemoryError

maxAvailableMemoryPercentage.desc: The server will refuse to serve when the used memory (heap memory + JVM internal non-heap memory + direct buffer pool) exceeds the physical memory of the percentage. The server will try to reserve max(maxAvailableMemoryPercentage of the physical memory, minFreeSystemMemoryBytes) for kernel and other processes. Note that the max available memory percentage doesn't conflict with the usage of limiting memory in docker because docker limits the memory of the container, while this memory percentage only limits the available memory for JVM

minFreeSystemMemoryBytes.desc: The server will refuse to serve when the free system memory is less than minFreeSystemMemoryBytes

publicIpDetectorAddresses.desc: The public IP detectors will only be used to query the public IP of the local node if needed (e.g. If the discovery property "advertiseStrategy" is "PUBLIC_ADDRESS"

treatUserIdAndDeviceTypeAsUniqueUser.desc: Whether to treat the pair of user ID and device type as a unique user when querying users nearby. If false, only the user ID is used to identify a unique user

defaultMaxAvailableNearbyUsersNumber.desc: The default maximum available number of nearby users

defaultMaxDistanceMeters.desc: The default maximum distance limit in meters

maxAvailableUsersNearbyNumberLimit.desc: The maximum allowed available number of users nearby records

maxDistanceMeters.desc: The maximum distance limit in meters

allowSave.desc: Whether to allow to save plugins using HTTP API
Whether to allow to save plugins using HTTP API

blockTriggerTimes.desc: Block the client when the block condition is triggered the times
Block the client when the block condition is triggered the times
Block the client when the block condition is triggered the times
Block the client when the block condition is triggered the times
Block the client when the block condition is triggered the times
Block the client when the block condition is triggered the times

adminPasswordEncodingAlgorithm.desc: The password encoding algorithm for admins

initialRootPassword.desc: The initial password of the root user

userPasswordEncodingAlgorithm.desc: The password encoding algorithm for users

advertiseHost.desc: The advertise address of the local node exposed to admins. (e.g. 100.131.251.96)

advertiseStrategy.desc: The advertise strategy is used to decide which type of address should be used so that admins can access admin APIs and metrics APIs

attachPortToHost.desc:
Whether to attach the local port to the host.
e.g. The local host is 100.131.251.96, and the port is 9510 so the service address will be 100.131.251.96:9510

allowDeleteWithoutFilter.desc: Whether to allow administrators to delete data without any filter. Better false to prevent administrators from deleting all data by accident

defaultAvailableRecordsPerRequest.desc: The default available records per query request

enabled.desc: Whether to enable the APIs for administrators

logRequestParams.desc: Whether to log the parameters of requests

maxAvailableOnlineUsersStatusPerRequest.desc: The maximum available online users' status per query request

maxAvailableRecordsPerRequest.desc: The maximum available records per query request

maxDayDifferencePerCountRequest.desc: The maximum day difference per count request

maxDayDifferencePerRequest.desc: The maximum day difference per query request

maxHourDifferencePerCountRequest.desc: The maximum hour difference per count request

maxMonthDifferencePerCountRequest.desc: The maximum month difference per count request

capacity.desc: The maximum number of tokens that the bucket can hold

initialTokens.desc: The initial number of tokens for new session

refillIntervalMillis.desc: The time interval to refill. 0 means never refill

tokensPerPeriod.desc: Refills the bucket with the specified number of tokens per period if the bucket isn't full

useAuthentication.desc: Whether to use authentication. If false, all HTTP requesters will personate the root user and all HTTP requests will be passed. You may set it to false when you want to manage authentication via security groups, NACL, etc

disabledEndpoints.desc: The disabled endpoints for client requests. Return ILLEGAL_ARGUMENT if a client tries to access them

excludedNotificationCategories.desc: Turms will get the notifications to log from the union of "includedNotificationCategories" and "includedNotifications" except the notifications included in "excludedNotificationCategories" and "excludedNotificationTypes"

excludedNotificationTypes.desc: Turms will get the notifications to log from the union of "includedNotificationCategories" and "includedNotifications" except the notifications included in "excludedNotificationCategories" and "excludedNotificationTypes"

excludedRequestCategories.desc: Turms will get the requests to log from the union of "includedRequestCategories" and "includedRequests" except the requests included in "excludedRequestCategories" and "excludedRequestTypes"

excludedRequestTypes.desc: Turms will get the requests to log from the union of "includedRequestCategories" and "includedRequests" except the requests included in "excludedRequestCategories" and "excludedRequestTypes"

includedNotificationCategories.desc: Turms will get the notifications to log from the union of "includedNotificationCategories" and "includedNotifications" except the notifications included in "excludedNotificationCategories" and "excludedNotificationTypes"

includedNotifications.desc: Turms will get the notifications to log from the union of "includedNotificationCategories" and "includedNotifications" except the notifications included in "excludedNotificationCategories" and "excludedNotificationTypes"

includedRequestCategories.desc: Turms will get the requests to log from the union of "includedRequestCategories" and "includedRequests" except the requests included in "excludedRequestCategories" and "excludedRequestTypes"

includedRequests.desc: Turms will get the requests to log from the union of "includedRequestCategories" and "includedRequests" except the requests included in "excludedRequestCategories" and "excludedRequestTypes"

allowMoveReadDateForward.desc: Whether to allow to move the last read date forward

enabled.desc: Whether to allow to update the last read date

updateReadDateAfterMessageSent.desc: Whether to update the read date after a user sent a message

updateReadDateWhenUserQueryingMessage.desc: Whether to update the read date when a user queries messages

useServerTime.desc: Whether to use the server time to set the last read date when updating

enabled.desc: Whether to notify users of typing statuses sent by other users

clearAllCollectionsBeforeFaking.desc: Whether to clear all collections before faking at startup

enabled.desc: Whether to fake data. Note that faking only works in non-production environments

fakeIfCollectionExists.desc: Whether to fake data even if the collection has already existed

userCount.desc: the total number of users to fake

activateGroupWhenCreated.desc: Whether to activate a group when created by default

deleteGroupLogicallyByDefault.desc: Whether to delete groups logically by default

allowRecallPendingInvitationByOwnerAndMa.desc: Whether to allow the owner and managers of a group to recall pending group invitations

deleteExpiredInvitationsWhenCronTriggere.desc: Whether to delete expired group invitations when the cron expression is triggered

expireAfterSeconds.desc: A group invitation will become expired after the specified time has passed

expiredInvitationsCleanupCron.desc: Clean the expired group invitations when the cron expression is triggered if "deleteExpiredInvitationsWhenCronTriggered" is true

maxContentLength.desc: The maximum allowed length for the text of a group invitation

allowRecallJoinRequestSentByOneself.desc: Whether to allow users to recall the join requests sent by themselves

deleteExpiredJoinRequestsWhenCronTrigger.desc: Whether to delete expired group join requests when the cron expression is triggered

expireAfterSeconds.desc: A group join request will become expired after the specified time has elapsed

expiredJoinRequestsCleanupCron.desc: Clean the expired group join requests when the cron expression is triggered if "deleteExpiredJoinRequestsWhenCronTriggered" is true

maxContentLength.desc: The maximum allowed length for the text of a group join request

memberCacheExpireAfterSeconds.desc: The group member cache will expire after the specified seconds. If 0, no group member cache

answerContentLimit.desc: The maximum allowed length for the text of a group question's answer

maxAnswerCount.desc: The maximum number of answers for a group question

questionContentLimit.desc: The maximum allowed length for the text of a group question

allowEditMessageBySender.desc: Whether to allow the sender of a message to edit the message

allowRecallMessage.desc:
Whether to allow users to recall messages.
Note: To recall messages, more system resources are needed

allowSendMessagesToOneself.desc: Whether to allow users to send messages to themselves

allowSendMessagesToStranger.desc: Whether to allow users to send messages to a stranger

availableRecallDurationSeconds.desc: The available recall duration for the sender of a message

sentMessageCacheMaxSize.desc: The maximum size of the cache of sent messages.

sentMessageExpireAfter.desc: The retention period of sent messages in the cache. For a better performance, it is a good practice to keep the value greater than the allowed recall duration

checkIfTargetActiveAndNotDeleted.desc: Whether to check if the target (recipient or group) of a message is active and not deleted

defaultAvailableMessagesNumberWithTotal.desc: The default available messages number with the "total" field that users request

deleteMessageLogicallyByDefault.desc: Whether to delete messages logically by default

expiredMessagesCleanupCron.desc: Clean the expired messages when the cron expression is triggered

maxRecordsSizeBytes.desc: The maximum allowed size for the records of a message

maxTextLimit.desc: The maximum allowed length for the text of a message

messageRetentionPeriodHours.desc: A message will be retained for the given period and will be removed from the database after the retention period

persistMessage.desc:
Whether to persist messages in databases.
Note: If false, senders will not get the message ID after the message has sent and cannot edit it

persistPreMessageId.desc: Whether to persist the previous message ID of messages in databases

persistRecord.desc: Whether to persist the records of messages in databases

persistSenderIp.desc: Whether to persist the sender IP of messages in databases

sendMessageToOtherSenderOnlineDevices.desc: Whether to send the message to the other sender's online devices when sending a message

useSequenceIdForGroupConversation.desc: Whether to use the sequence ID for group conversations so that the client can be aware of the loss of messages. Note that the property has a significant impact on performance

useSequenceIdForPrivateConversation.desc: Whether to use the sequence ID for private conversations so that the client can be aware of the loss of messages. Note that the property has a significant impact on performance

timeType.desc: The time type for the delivery time of message

useConversationId.desc: Whether to use conversation ID so that a user can query the messages sent by themselves in a conversation quickly

tiers.desc: The storage properties for tiers from hot to cold. Note that the order of the tiers is important

notifyGroupConversationParticipantsAfter.desc: Whether to notify the group conversation participants after the read receipt of a conversation has been updated by recipients

notifyInviteeAfterGroupInvitationRecalle.desc: Whether to notify the invitee after a group invitation has been recalled

notifyMemberAfterInfoUpdatedByOthers.desc: Whether to notify members after its member information has been updated by others

notifyMemberAfterRemovedFromRelationship.desc: Whether to notify the member after removed from a one-sided relationship group by others

notifyMembersAfterGroupDeleted.desc: Whether to notify members after a group has been removed

notifyMembersAfterGroupUpdated.desc: Whether to notify members after a group has been updated

notifyMembersAfterOneSidedRelationshipGr.desc: Whether to notify members after a one-sided relationship group has been updated by others

notifyMembersAfterOtherMemberInfoUpdated.desc: Whether to notify members after other group member's information has been updated

notifyMembersAfterOtherMemberOnlineStatu.desc: Whether to notify members after other group member's online status has been updated

notifyOwnerAndManagersAfterGroupJoinRequ.desc: Whether to notify the owner and managers after a group invitation has been recalled

notifyOwnerAndManagersAfterReceivingJoin.desc: Whether to notify the owner and managers after a join request has been received

notifyPrivateConversationParticipantAfte.desc: Whether to notify the private conversation participant after the read receipt of a conversation has been updated by the recipient

notifyRecipientWhenReceivingFriendReques.desc: Whether to notify the recipient when receiving a friend request

notifyRecipientsAfterMessageUpdatedBySen.desc: Whether to notify the recipients after a message has been updated by the sender

notifyRelatedUserAfterAddedToOneSidedRel.desc: Whether to notify the related user after added to a one-sided relationship group by others

notifyRelatedUserAfterOneSidedRelationsh.desc: Whether to notify the related user after a one-sided relationship has benn updated by others

notifyRelatedUsersAfterOtherRelatedUserI.desc: Whether to notify related users after other related user's information has been updated

notifyRelatedUsersAfterOtherRelatedUserO.desc: Whether to notify related users after other related user's online status has been updated

notifyRequesterAfterFriendRequestUpdated.desc: Whether to notify the requester after a friend request has been updated

notifyUserAfterAddedToGroupByOthers.desc: Whether to notify the user after added to a group by others

notifyUserAfterBlockedByGroup.desc: Whether to notify the user after blocked by a group

notifyUserAfterInvitedByGroup.desc: Whether to notify the user after invited by a group

notifyUserAfterRemovedFromGroupByOthers.desc: Whether to notify the user after removed from a group by others

notifyUserAfterUnblockedByGroup.desc: Whether to notify the user after unblocked by a group

logOnlineUsersNumber.desc: Whether to log online users number

onlineUsersNumberLoggingCron.desc: The cron expression to specify the time to log online users' number

activateUserWhenAdded.desc: Whether to activate a user when added by default

deleteTwoSidedRelationships.desc: Whether to delete the two-sided relationships when a user requests to delete a relationship

deleteUserLogically.desc: Whether to delete a user logically

allowSendRequestAfterDeclinedOrIgnoredOr.desc: Whether to allow resending a friend request after the previous request has been declined, ignored, or expired

deleteExpiredRequestsWhenCronTriggered.desc: Whether to delete expired when the cron expression is triggered

expiredUserFriendRequestsCleanupCron.desc: Clean expired friend requests when the cron expression is triggered if deleteExpiredRequestsWhenCronTriggered is true

friendRequestExpireAfterSeconds.desc: A friend request will become expired after the expireAfter has elapsed

maxContentLength.desc: The maximum allowed length for the text of a friend request

maxIntroLength.desc: The maximum allowed length for a user's intro

maxNameLength.desc: The maximum allowed length for a user's name

maxPasswordLength.desc: The maximum allowed length for a user's password

maxProfilePictureLength.desc: The maximum allowed length for a user's profile picture

respondOfflineIfInvisible.desc: Whether to respond to client with the OFFLINE status if a user is in INVISIBLE status

jobTimeoutMillis.desc: Wait for a job 2 minutes at most for extreme cases by default. Though it's a long time, graceful shutdown is usually better than force shutdown.

cacheUserSessionsStatus.desc: Whether to cache the user sessions status

userSessionsStatusCacheMaxSize.desc: The maximum size of the cache of users' sessions status

userSessionsStatusExpireAfter.desc: The life duration of each remote user's sessions status in the cache. Note that the cache will make the presentation of users' sessions status inconsistent during the time
